name: Equity LLP
tag_list: legal, law-firm, accelerator, startups, early-stage, legal-services, business-strategy, mentors, advisors, incubators, funding, venture-capital
overview:
Equity is a law firm that works as a business accelerator, devoted entirely to the legal and corporate governance needs of early-stage tech startups. We have an application process like other accelerators—considering team member biographies, product capabilities, referral quality, and other objective predictors of success. We look for founders who have quit their day jobs to dedicate 100% to building products, who have disruptive ideas, and who are eager to join a community of business leaders and senior lawyers. Ideally, we catch them in a teachable moment just before or after starting their company, and show them the Silicon Valley way.

What we do

Equity guides batches of company CEOs, CFOs, and COOs through the entire startup process, from organization and stock issuance to trademarks, finance, hiring, licensing, conducting board meetings, and thinking through their product’s legal implications. We even make sure they get a bank account. Plus, we have a community of top lawyers, mentors, and advisors to offer extended support, networking, and community. After three months our company trainees take the wheels for themselves. We use 100% standard document sets and best practices, so by the end of the program they have a fundable company with a clean cap table that will pass through the investor due diligence process. Plus, now they know how to start a company. It costs nothing for those accepted into the all-inclusive program. We ask for a modest equity exchange, plus their time and dedication. We’re backed by a high-end boutique firm for the advanced issues that need special attention.
We also love to work with company lawyers and other accelerators, serving as a modular value- add. Others do it all; we do law.

video_embeds.description: TechCrunch TV Talks to Andrea Regarding the Equity Accelerator
